intro: Arrozia micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered arrozia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly hairy texture. Arrozia micrantha is typically found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
